avalancheActivity.comment:
15 to 25 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, has fallen since yesterday above approximately 1800 m.
In the last few days sometimes avalanche prone wind slabs formed in all aspects. These must be evaluated with care and prudence above approximately 2400 m. Even single backcountry tourers can release avalanches in some places, including medium-sized ones. Remotely triggered avalanches are possible in isolated cases. Additionally avalanches can also penetrate down to the ground and reach quite a large size in the regions exposed to heavier precipitation.
The avalanche prone locations are to be found on steep slopes and adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls. The fresh and older wind slabs are to be avoided.
avalancheActivity.highlights: New snow and wind slabs represent the main danger, especially along the border with Switzerland.

snowpackStructure.comment: As a consequence of highly fluctuating temperatures, snowfall and the occasionally storm force westerly wind, the snowpack could not consolidate. The fresh and somewhat older wind slabs are poorly bonded with the old snowpack in particular on northwest to east to south facing aspects. Snow depths vary greatly at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions, depending on the infuence of the wind. Below the tree line only a little snow is lying.

tendency.comment: As a consequence of warming, the likelihood of dry and moist avalanches being released will increase a little. In the event of rain this applies in particular.

avalancheActivity.comment:
In the west 10 to 15 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, has fallen since yesterday.
In the last few days sometimes avalanche prone wind slabs formed on north, east and southeast facing slopes. These must be evaluated with care and prudence above approximately 2500 m. Even single backcountry tourers can release avalanches in some places, including medium-sized ones. In some places avalanches can also be released in near-surface layers of the snowpack and reach medium size in the regions exposed to heavier precipitation.
The fresh and older wind slabs are to be avoided. The avalanche prone locations are to be found on steep slopes and adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls. The avalanche danger is close to the boundary with danger level 3 (considerable).
avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind and new snow, especially along the border with France. As the day progresses as a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation there will be only a slight increase in the danger of dry and moist avalanches.

snowpackStructure.comment: As a consequence of highly fluctuating temperatures, snowfall and the occasionally storm force westerly wind, the snowpack could not consolidate. The fresh and somewhat older wind slabs are poorly bonded with the old snowpack in particular on northwest to east to south facing aspects. Snow depths vary greatly at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions, depending on the infuence of the wind. Below the tree line only a little snow is lying.

tendency.comment: As a consequence of warming, the likelihood of snow slides and avalanches being released will increase. In the event of rain this applies in particular. The avalanche danger will increase during the day, reaching danger level 3 (considerable).

avalancheActivity.comment:
In the last few days sometimes avalanche prone wind slabs formed in high Alpine regions. Some fresh snow and the mostly small wind slabs can be released easily or naturally especially on north to east to south facing aspects above approximately 2400 m.
In some places new snow is lying on an icy crust. Restraint should be exercised because avalanches can sweep people along and give rise to falls.
Slight increase in danger of dry and moist avalanches as a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions. As a consequence of warming, the likelihood of moist snow slides and avalanches being released will increase.

snowpackStructure.comment: In all altitude zones less snow than usual is lying. Below approximately 2200 m from a snow sport perspective, in most cases insufficient snow is lying. Snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind. The snowpack is largely stable and its surface consists of loosely bonded snow lying on a strong melt-freeze crust. Towards its base, the snowpack is moist.

avalancheActivity.comment: 5 to 10 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, has fallen since yesterday above approximately 2000 m. In some places new snow is lying on an icy crust. The small wind slabs of the last few days can be released in isolated cases on extremely steep shady slopes and generally in high Alpine regions. Restraint should be exercised because avalanches can sweep people along and give rise to falls.
avalancheActivity.highlights: New snow and wind slabs in the high Alpine regions. The avalanche prone locations are rather rare.

snowpackStructure.comment: In all aspects as well as in all altitude zones from a snow sport perspective, in most cases insufficient snow is lying. The snowpack is largely stable and its surface consists of loosely bonded snow lying on a strong crust. The avalanche prone locations are very rare.
